Arnout Elsevier - Aernout Elsevier was a Dutch Golden Age landscape painter.
Elsevier B.V. is a publishing company which publishes medical and scientific literature.

wiki.text: {{Infobox publisher | image = parent = Reed Elsevier status = founded = 1880 founder = successor | = country = Netherlands headquarters = Amsterdam distribution = keypeople | = publications = topics = genre = imprints = revenue = numemployees = | nasdaq = url = }} 'Elsevier B.V.' () is a publishing company which publishes medical and scientific literature. It is a part of the Reed Elsevier group. Based in Amsterdam, the company has operations in the United Kingdom, USA, and elsewhere. Leading products include journals such as [[The Lancet]] and [[Cell (journal)|Cell]], books such as [[Gray's Anatomy]], the ScienceDirect collection of electronic journals, the [[Trends (journals)|Trends]] and [[Current Opinion]] series of journals, and the online citation database Scopus. Its free researcher collaboration tool, 2collab, launched in 2007, was discontinued in 2011. Elsevier publishes 250,000 articles a year in 2,000 journals."[http://www.elsevier.com/wps/find/intro.cws_home/ataglance Elsevier at a glance]". Elsevier. Its archives contain seven million publications. Total yearly downloads amount to 240 million.[http://www.elsevier.com/wps/find/intro.cws_home/glance_1 Journal publishing at Elsevier]. Elsevier. Retrieved 3 September 2011. In 2010, Elsevier reported a profit margin of 36% on revenues of US$3.2 billion. Elsevier accounts for 28% of the revenues of the Reed Elsevier group (₤1.5b of 5.4 billions in 2006). In operating profits, it represents a bigger fraction of 44% (₤395 of 880 millions).[http://www.investis.com/reports/reed_ar_2006_en/report.php?type=0&page=98 Reed Elsevier | Annual Report and Financial Statements 2006] Adjusted operating profits rose by 10% from 2005 to 2006.- [http://www.investis.com/reports/reed_ar_2006_en/report.php?type=0&page=17 Reed Elsevier | Annual Report and Financial Statements 2006] {| class="wikitable" style="float:right;" |- ! colspan=3 | Reed Elsevier Annual Report ! 2011 |- 'Turnover' € 6,902 million - 'Pre-tax profit' € 1,090 million - ! colspan=3 | Reed Elsevier Annual Report ! 2012 |- 'Turnover' £ 2,063 million (+0.2% from '11) - 'Adjusted Operating Profit' £ |780 million (+1.6% from '11) - colspan=3 | see Elsevier reports; turnover = revenue; profits not adjusted }
